answers.answer: See I made a post EXACTLY like this at about 37 weeks and now I realize the frustration overdue mothers had. I made a post today- so if it is directed towards me or not is another thing. I'm 40w2d with a scheduled c section for next Tuesday due to a cervix "problem." I made a post today because I've tried everything to get my cervix in position and ready so that I wouldn't have to go through it.I'm definitely NOT going to miss the frustration waking up everyday knowing I'm one day closer to something I am 100% scared about and that the things I've tried weren't making any progress.

I totally understand - living in an instant gratification society people want what they want NOW lol. With having to wait for almost nothing nowadays (even three minutes in a drive thru pisses some people off haha) waiting an entire pregnancy must be an eternity for some people. I too am seeing people being induced for no other medical reason than impatience lol. Just wait till it's the baby that's the impatient one and they realize this WAS the easy part!
OwensMadre - yours is a bit different - medically necessary and you're overdue lol :)
Lol very true. If she's referring to the 30-38 weeks pregnant women I get it but at 39 I was already becoming impatient. :P

Some woman wanting this to hurry up doesn't always mean they are wanting "instant gratification". I'm on my 4th and last pregnancy and yes I want it over because im anxious to meet my child, but literally from day one of finding out I was pregnant I've had nearly everything go wrong (so far no pre eclampsia thank God) but I'm in constant pelvic and pelvic girdle pain that doesn't allow me to walk for very long. I've had kidney stones 4 times (once requiring surgery) I have gestational diabetes, and plecenta previa. I've had severe RLS that interrupts my sleep due mostly in part to being anemic and for the majority of the first trimester I was unable to have a bowel moment naturally (going 3 weeks without one at all) I'm DONE with being pregnant and I'm ready for the next chapter.

I can't say I have really liked any of my pregnancy thus far. I am also ocd about things and I feel like my body isn't my own. I am weirded out by the movements and I feel like it's alien invasion. Don't get me wrong I am excited to be a mother but I think if I want more children in the future, I may adopt. I just don't like being pregnant. I hate the attention. I hate how everyone treats me like I am breakable. I feel weak and less than 100% which makes it tough for me. I guess the only part I have liked is seeing my daughter on the ultrasound. I haven't met her but I already love her to pieces!

I get some people being tires I'm 38w1d yea I'm tired I'm sometime s is difficult an your frustrated w this pregnancy symptoms but then again I'm like idont want to give birth cause i already know how painful is those constraccion waiting is all part of the process nobody have being pregnant forever. :)
Im not in a rush at all haha im 35 weeks ...heavy but what can u do ..5 more weeks and i should be done...will go back to normal afterwards :))

I'm impatient because I'm only 22 weeks... Seems like it will be forever! But I wouldn't want my baby coming any too early! My 1st came on her due date! Drs wanted to induce me a week early and it was tempting but I said no I'd rather meet my baby when they are ready.
I am 31weeks today & i absolutly enjoy every movement my baby makes, i missed that feeling with my 1st son. Im physically tired bt NT tired of being pregnant, who knows when ill have my next baby(:

Snowdin28 - that's why I covered medical in my statement :) so sorry your pregnancy hasn't been great - I've had medical issues too, but unless it's medically necessary I give birth sooner, I'm going to enjoy my time before the baby comes :)

Im 39 weeks, not impatient just in a lot of sciatic pain. When I have Braxton hicks it just intensifies the pain and shoots it down my legs. Haven't slept in over a week. I'm just ready for some relief and an epidural. Lol.

I started getting antsy with my daughter at 41+5... And I started getting antsy cuz I was on my way to the hospital to get the ball rolling... I technically only have 9 weeks left this time but know I could have up to 11 left. I like my babies staying in until they are ready to come out.

I completely understand both sides of the spectrum... with my first I went into labor by myself at 38 weeks.... I am hoping that it goes by the same timeframes with this one, but I won't do anything different than last time... with my last pregnancy I walked and had sex... I walked because I had to walk the dog and the mailbox was a few blocks away... I had sex just to have sex-- not to induce... Ifigured she would come when she wanted rto although I was very uncomfortable. ... this time around I fear that they are going to have to induce me or give me a c section-- neither of what I want...but im high risk for preeclampsia and I already have gestational diabetes.... this is my last pregnancy so I was hoping I would really enjoy it.. but im not... I am severely uncomfortable and paranoid that I won't be able to deliver my baby for fear she will get too big... and a c section or induction just terrifies me

I think the same. But, stop posting this. I've seen si many posts about this same thing. Come on, just everyone mind their own business. Let it b. Your not in their shoes, n we can't judge them. All the girls I've read about that wasn't too get this over w, has been from 37 weeks n on. It's their decision, n no matter what u have to say, they'll do whatever they want.
I am an extremely impatient person. I've been ready for the pregnancy to be done at like week 10. Love the outcome, hate the process.

As a first time mom I take major offense to this post. First off I've worked a full time job my entire pregnancy 40+ hours a week. I commute over 60 miles a day to work and back home. I am 36+5 says pregnant and my baby is on track to be 11 lbs by his due date. So forgive me for wanting to hurt this along. Not everybody has had multiple children and knows what to expect afterwards. People are entitled to feel exactly how they want to feel and this post is 100% out of line!
Hooooooormones!!

Im a ftm work 40+ a week and attend school full time as well, my commute is 45 miles away. Baby is due in June, im considered high risk due to placenta previa, a fall i sustained at home and a crazy ex co worker that has been making me overly stress. But to be honest,  I love this experience. I dont want to end!!!! Everytime I feel my son move in my belly it fills my heart. I love it, every move he makes every hiccup I feel. I love it.I wouldnt mind being pregnant longer. Lol I guess it varies from person to person but as far as we go. We are loving this experience. Im 30 weeks 4 days and I believe everyone is entitled to feel how they want to feel. After all its all due to those darn hormones.

I just want to say that, with pregnancy every experience is completely different, so the best thing to do is try not to compare or assume what you think someone else is going through. For some, they can sit back and say "pregnancy is wonderful, just enjoy it". But for others like myself, they are just struggling with pain and sickness just hoping to get to the next day. It's hard to enjoy the constant urge to vomit for 9 months straight and the severe pain that keeps many from being able to sleep or even sit comfortably. Hang in there ladies, and if you don't enjoy being pregnant, that's completely understandable! I'm sure you will love your baby all the more for what you endured.

question: No offense to anyone, but all I see are posts about how they are done and cant wait for the baby to get out. I completely understand,  but this is my 3rd baby and I am going to suck it all in until the end. I know this is my last child for at least 5 years and possibly my last child all together, we havent decided. But believe me ladies, once that baby is out, there is no going back. You will miss this. (Unless you are like my friend and completely hate the whole experience from the beginning) lol
title: everyone is so impatient
